gauge 20 sts and 40 row = 4 in garter stitch with 2 strands held together check your gauge to ensure a proper fit suggested needle us 5 3 75 mm use whatever size needle you need to obtain gauge notes since garter stitch looks the same on rs and ws it may be helpful to place a removal stitch marker in the rs of your knitting to differentiate rs from ws it is not necessary to wrap and turn while working short row the compact row gauge of garter stitch will close up any holes caused by turning you can wrap and turn if you want but it s not necessary the first row worked is a ws row the mitt
